definition: all the rage for a time/grand fashion for a limited time
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: This academy had its heyday in the Southern Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这座书院在南宋的时候可是盛极一时。

sentences.english: Engraving printing is in vogue for a time from its being invented to the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 雕版印刷发明后至两宋而盛极一时。

sentences.english: As a once thriving capital, Yinxu is rich in archeological relics.
sentences.chinese: 作为盛极一时的都邑，殷墟地下文物遗迹十分丰富。

definition: to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
to enjoy a short-lived fame or position of power
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
flourishing age (of the ceremonial tripod)/golden age
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
lit. to rebuke Heaven and Earth (idiom); fig. shaking the whole world/all-powerful
